Ignore anyone who says "But its for Children !" - that has nothing to do with the monumentally pathetic storyboard
column62: the abysmal script or the films philosphical aim - which can only be described as a barely disguised insult to celloliod and anyone who paid for a ticket. The fact that the critics gave it 90% but less than half the audidence even liked it shows you the difference between ensureing the sucess of a commercially important release - with what its actually like to watch this moronically laughable collection of offensively incongrous scenes and shocking character discontinuity - the likes of which can only be described as a fan-fiction humours parody accidentally sent out as the real film. Each and ever segment can be rated as "what is the LEAST likely thing that could possibly happen in the original star-wars universe ? '
